entry.et: Middle English, pron. & adjective, from Old English thes (masculine), this (neuter); akin to Old High German dese this, Old English thæt that

def.dt: :the person, thing, or idea that is present or near in place, time, or thought or that has just been mentioned these are my hands
:what is stated in the following phrase, clause, or discourse I can only say this: it wasn't here yesterday
:this time or place expected to return before this
:the one nearer or more immediately under observation or discussion this is iron and that is tin
:the one more recently referred to
:being the person, thing, or idea that is present or near in place, time, or thought or that has just been mentioned this book is mine early this morning
:constituting the immediately following part of the present discourse
:constituting the immediate past or future friends all these years
:being one not previously mentioned used especially in narrative to give a sense of immediacy or vividness then this guy runs in had this urge to go shopping
:being the nearer at hand or more immediately under observation or discussion this car or that one
:to the degree or extent indicated by something in the immediate context or situation didn't expect to wait this long

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English sīde; akin to Old High German sīta side, Old English sīd ample, wide

def.dt: :the right or left part of the wall or trunk of the body a pain in the side
:one of the halves of the animal body on either side of the median plane
:a cut of meat including that about the ribs of one half of the body used chiefly of smoked pork products
:one longitudinal half of a hide
:a place, space, or direction with respect to a center or to a line of division (as of an aisle, river, or street)
:one of the longer bounding surfaces or lines of an object especially contrasted with the ends the side of a barn
:a line or surface forming a border or face of an object a die has six sides the back side of the moon
:either surface of a thin object one side of a record right side of the cloth
:a bounding line of a geometric figure side of a triangle
:the space beside one stood by my side
:an area next to something usually used in combination a poolside interview
:a slope (as of a hill) considered as opposed to another slope the far side of the hill
:the attitude or activity of one person or group with respect to another :part there was no malice on my side
:a position that is opposite to or contrasted with another two sides to every question came down on the side of law and order
:a body of partisans or contestants victory for neither side
:team 4a 11 players on each side
:the players on a baseball team batting in an inning struck out the side
:a line of descent traced through one's parent grandfather on his mother's side
:an aspect or part of something contrasted with some other real or implied aspect or part the better side of his nature the sales side of the business the seasoning is a bit on the heavy side
:sideways spin imparted to a billiard or snooker ball
:a sheet containing the lines and cues for a single theatrical role
:a recording of music
:a side order or dish a side of fries
:in addition to the main portion
:in addition to a principal occupation
:secretly outside of one's marriage or romantic relationship seeing another woman on the side
:short of :almost an attitude just this side of scandalous
:swaggering or arrogant manner :pretentiousness
:interest in, concern with, or devotion to things of this world especially as opposed to a future stage of existence (as after death)
:characterized by or manifesting this-worldliness
